clusters.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene to resign from Congress in January amid fallout with Trump
clusters.neutral_headline: Marjorie Taylor Greene Resigns from Congress

items.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene to resign from Congress in January amid fallout with Trump
items.standfirst: Decision by Georgia Republican and leading Maga figure to give up House seat comes after dramatic break with Trump, lately over the Epstein files billReaction: Trump calls resignation ‘great news for the country’From staunch Trump ally to ‘traitor’: key takeaways of Marjorie Taylor Greene’s careerMarjorie Taylor Greene announced on Friday evening she will be resigning from office effective 5 January 2026, in the wake of souring relations with President Donald Trump, mostly recently over a vote to force the release of files related to the late Jeffrey Epstein.In a four-page statement, the Georgia congresswoman said the legislative branch had been “sidelined” and accused Republican leaders of refusing to advance conservative priorities such as border security or “America First” policies. Continue reading...
items.content: Decision by Georgia Republican and leading Maga figure to give up House seat comes after dramatic break with Trump, lately over the Epstein files billReaction: Trump calls resignation ‘great news for the country’From staunch Trump ally to ‘traitor’: key takeaways of Marjorie Taylor Greene’s careerMarjorie Taylor Greene announced on Friday evening she will be resigning from office effective 5 January 2026, in the wake of souring relations with President Donald Trump, mostly recently over a vote to force the release of files related to the late Jeffrey Epstein.In a four-page statement, the Georgia congresswoman said the legislative branch had been “sidelined” and accused Republican leaders of refusing to advance conservative priorities such as border security or “America First” policies. Continue reading...

items.title: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene says she's resigning from Congress
items.standfirst: Republican Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia announced on X Friday​ she will resign from Congress early next year, after a weekslong falling-out with President Trump and much of her party.
items.content: Republican Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia announced on X Friday​ she will resign from Congress early next year, after a weekslong falling-out with President Trump and much of her party.

items.title: Trump calls Marjorie Taylor Greene resignation ‘great news for the country’
items.standfirst: President says ‘I think she should be happy’ while Democratic colleague praises her for stance on Epstein filesFull report: Marjorie Taylor Greene to resign from Congress in JanuaryFrom staunch Trump ally to ‘traitor’: key takeaways of Marjorie Taylor Greene’s careerMarjorie Taylor Greene, the Republican Georgia congresswoman who had a dramatic blow-up with Donald Trump despite being his longtime ally, announced on Friday she would be resigning – which the president called “great news”.“Loyalty should be a two-way street,” Greene said in a lengthy resignation statement shared on social media, adding that it was “unfair and wrong” that Trump turned on her for disagreeing with him. Continue reading...
items.content: President says ‘I think she should be happy’ while Democratic colleague praises her for stance on Epstein filesFull report: Marjorie Taylor Greene to resign from Congress in JanuaryFrom staunch Trump ally to ‘traitor’: key takeaways of Marjorie Taylor Greene’s careerMarjorie Taylor Greene, the Republican Georgia congresswoman who had a dramatic blow-up with Donald Trump despite being his longtime ally, announced on Friday she would be resigning – which the president called “great news”.“Loyalty should be a two-way street,” Greene said in a lengthy resignation statement shared on social media, adding that it was “unfair and wrong” that Trump turned on her for disagreeing with him. Continue reading...

items.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene announces resignation; Trump and Mamdani have cordial White House meeting – as it happened
items.standfirst: This live blog is now closed.Marjorie Taylor Greene to resign from office effective January 2026Trump news at a glance: president meets Mamdani at White House and it was … nice?Robert Garcia, the ranking member on the House oversight committee, has sent a letter to the US attorney general, Pam Bondi, urging the justice department to release the complete trove of files related to Jeffrey Epstein, despite the newly launched investigation into several Democrats’ ties to the late sex offender.“There is already a concern President Trump will attempt, on dubious legal grounds, to exploit a provision which allows DoJ to withhold information relevant to ongoing investigations,” Garcia wrote. Continue reading...
items.content: This live blog is now closed.Marjorie Taylor Greene to resign from office effective January 2026Trump news at a glance: president meets Mamdani at White House and it was … nice?Robert Garcia, the ranking member on the House oversight committee, has sent a letter to the US attorney general, Pam Bondi, urging the justice department to release the complete trove of files related to Jeffrey Epstein, despite the newly launched investigation into several Democrats’ ties to the late sex offender.“There is already a concern President Trump will attempt, on dubious legal grounds, to exploit a provision which allows DoJ to withhold information relevant to ongoing investigations,” Garcia wrote. ai_summary: Marjorie Taylor Greene announced her resignation from Congress, effective January 5, 2026.
The resignation follows a falling out with Donald Trump over various policy disagreements.
Trump called the resignation "great news" for the country in a public statement.
Greene cited disagreements with Republican leadership and conservative priorities.
Her resignation comes after a vote regarding the Epstein files.

items.title: Trump’s new Thanksgiving deadline for Ukraine peace plan
items.standfirst: President Trump said Ukraine had a Thursday deadline to give an answer on his new 28-point peace plan to end the war in Ukraine. NBC News’ Keir Simmons reports.
items.content: President Trump said Ukraine had a Thursday deadline to give an answer on his new 28-point peace plan to end the war in Ukraine. NBC News’ Keir Simmons reports.

items.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine has impossible choice as Trump pushes plan to end war
items.standfirst: US president demands that Kyiv accepts plan that would mean giving up territory to Russia Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said Ukraine faces one of the most difficult moments in its history, after Donald Trump demanded Kyiv accepts within days a US-backed “peace plan” that would force it to give up territory to Russia and make other painful concessions.Trump confirmed on Friday morning that next Thursday – Thanksgiving in the US – would be an “acceptable” deadline for Zelenskyy to sign the deal, which European and Ukrainian officials have said amounts to a “capitulation”. Continue reading...

items.title: White House urges Ukraine to accept peace plan as Zelenskyy weighs repercussions
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials
items.content: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials

ai_summary: Donald Trump proposed a peace plan for Ukraine with a Thanksgiving deadline.
The plan reportedly involves Ukraine making concessions to Russia.
Ukrainian President Zelenskyy said the plan forces a difficult choice.
The plan is seen as potentially requiring Ukraine to cede territory.
Trump wants Ukraine to accept the plan by next Thursday.

clusters.title: Trump says he's terminating legal protections for Somali migrants in Minnesota

items.title: Trump says he's terminating legal protections for Somali migrants in Minnesota
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Friday night that he's "immediately" terminating temporary legal protections for Somali migrants living in Minnesota. The state has the nation's largest Somali community.
items.content: President Donald Trump said Friday night that he's "immediately" terminating temporary legal protections for Somali migrants living in Minnesota. The state has the nation's largest Somali community.(Image credit: Evan Vucci)

items.title: Trump Says He's Ending Temporary Protected Status for Somalis in Minnesota
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said he is ending the temporary protected status (TPS) program for Somalis in Minnesota, "effective immediately," in a post to Truth Social Friday night. Newsweek reached out to Democratic Minnesota Governor Tim Walz's office for comment. Why It Matters Trump’s decision to…

items.title: Trump says he is ending immigration protections for Somalis in Minnesota
items.standfirst: President claims he is ‘immediately’ terminating temporary protected status in US state with largest Somali communityDonald Trump said on Friday night he was “immediately” terminating temporary legal protections for Somali migrants living in Minnesota, further targeting a program seeking to limit deportations that his administration has already repeatedly sought to weaken.Minnesota has the nation’s largest Somali community. Many fled the long civil war in their east African country and were drawn to the state’s welcoming social programs. Continue reading...
items.content: President claims he is ‘immediately’ terminating temporary protected status in US state with largest Somali communityDonald Trump said on Friday night he was “immediately” terminating temporary legal protections for Somali migrants living in Minnesota, further targeting a program seeking to limit deportations that his administration has already repeatedly sought to weaken.Minnesota has the nation’s largest Somali community. Many fled the long civil war in their east African country and were drawn to the state’s welcoming social programs. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Donald Trump announced the end of Temporary Protected Status for Somalis in Minnesota.
The decision was announced via a post on Truth Social.
Minnesota has the largest Somali community in the United States.
The program aimed to limit deportations of Somali immigrants.
The termination is effective immediately, according to Trump's statement.

items.title: Nigerian Gunmen Abduct Over 200 Christian Children, 12 Teachers In Boarding School Attack
items.standfirst: Nigerian Gunmen Abduct Over 200 Christian Children, 12 Teachers In Boarding School Attack Armed men attacked a Catholic boarding school in northcentral Nigeria's Niger state in the early hours on Friday, abducting 215 students and 12 teachers, according to Daniel Atori, a spokesperson to the…
items.content: Nigerian Gunmen Abduct Over 200 Christian Children, 12 Teachers In Boarding School Attack Armed men attacked a Catholic boarding school in northcentral Nigeria's Niger state in the early hours on Friday, abducting 215 students and 12 teachers, according to Daniel Atori, a spokesperson to the…

items.title: Nigeria reels after 215 children taken in second mass school abduction in a week
items.standfirst: Twelve teachers also kidnapped from Catholic school amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted 215 schoolchildren and 12 teachers from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. Continue reading...
items.content: Twelve teachers also kidnapped from Catholic school amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted 215 schoolchildren and 12 teachers from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. items.title: Gunmen kidnap more than 200 students from school in Nigeria

items.content: Over 200 students have been kidnapped from a Catholic boarding school in western Nigeria - the second mass abduction in the country this week.

ai_summary: Gunmen abducted over 200 students and 12 teachers from a Nigerian school.
The attack occurred at a Catholic boarding school in Niger state.
This is the second mass school abduction in Nigeria within a week.
The abductions occurred amid threats of military intervention by Trump.
The Christian Association of Nigeria reported 215 students were taken.

clusters.title: US Supreme Court blocks order on likely racial bias in new Texas voter map
clusters.neutral_headline: Texas congressional map challenged in Supreme Court

items.title: US Supreme Court blocks order on likely racial bias in new Texas voter map
items.standfirst: Texas redrew its voting map as part of President Donald Trump's plan to win extra Republican seats in Congress in 2026.
items.content: Texas redrew its voting map as part of President Donald Trump's plan to win extra Republican seats in Congress in 2026.

items.title: Supreme Court blocks order that found Texas congressional map is likely racially biased
items.standfirst: The U.S. Supreme Court has temporarily blocked a lower court ruling that found Texas' 2026 congressional redistricting plan pushed by President Trump likely discriminates on the basis of race.
items.content: The U.S. Supreme Court has temporarily blocked a lower court ruling that found Texas' 2026 congressional redistricting plan pushed by President Trump likely discriminates on the basis of race. (Image credit: Eric Gay)

items.title: Texas seeks Supreme Court order to use congressional map judges ruled likely racially biased
items.standfirst: Texas on Friday asked the Supreme Court for an emergency order to be allowed to use a congressional redistricting plan pushed by President Donald Trump that is favorable to Republicans in the 2026 elections despite a lower court ruling that it likely discriminates on the basis of race.
items.content: Texas on Friday asked the Supreme Court for an emergency order to be allowed to use a congressional redistricting plan pushed by President Donald Trump that is favorable to Republicans in the 2026 elections despite a lower court ruling that it likely discriminates on the basis of race.

ai_summary: The Supreme Court blocked a lower court order on Texas's congressional map.
The lower court found the map likely racially biased.
Texas is seeking to use the map for the 2026 elections.
The map was pushed by Donald Trump.
The Supreme Court issued a temporary block on the lower court ruling.

clusters.title: 11 injured after grizzly bear attacks group of elementary school students
clusters.neutral_headline: Grizzly Bear Attacks Schoolchildren in Canada

items.title: 11 injured after grizzly bear attacks group of elementary school students
items.standfirst: A grizzly bear attacked a group of elementary school students and their teachers in British Columbia, injuring 11 people. Authorities say teachers were able to use bear spray and bear bangers to scare off the grizzly. NBC News’ Morgan Chesky reports.
items.content: A grizzly bear attacked a group of elementary school students and their teachers in British Columbia, injuring 11 people. Authorities say teachers were able to use bear spray and bear bangers to scare off the grizzly. NBC News’ Morgan Chesky reports.

items.title: Eleven injured after grizzly bear attacks schoolchildren and teachers in Canada
items.standfirst: Two critically hurt after attack on walking trail in British Columbia as police and conservation officers search for bearEleven people were injured, two of them critically, when a grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers on a walking trail in British Columbia, Canada.The attack happened on Thursday in Bella Coola, 435 miles (700km) north-west of Vancouver. The Nuxalk Nation said the “aggressive bear” remained on the loose and police and conservation officers were on the scene. Continue reading...
items.content: Two critically hurt after attack on walking trail in British Columbia as police and conservation officers search for bearEleven people were injured, two of them critically, when a grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers on a walking trail in British Columbia, Canada.The attack happened on Thursday in Bella Coola, 435 miles (700km) north-west of Vancouver. The Nuxalk Nation said the “aggressive bear” remained on the loose and police and conservation officers were on the scene. Continue reading...

items.title: Grizzly bear on loose after attacking school group in Canada, injuring 11
items.standfirst: A male teacher "got the whole brunt" of the attack and some children were hit with bear spray.
items.content: A male teacher "got the whole brunt" of the attack and some children were hit with bear spray.

items.title: 'Hero' teachers fended off grizzly that attacked students on Canada walking trail, injuring 11, officials said
items.standfirst: Teachers who were well prepared and well equipped may have ended a grizzly bear attack on their group of Canadian schoolchildren in British Columbia before it became deadly, authorities said Friday
items.content: Teachers who were well prepared and well equipped may have ended a grizzly bear attack on their group of Canadian schoolchildren in British Columbia before it became deadly, authorities said Friday

ai_summary: A grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers in Canada.

Teachers used bear spray and bear bangers to fend off the bear.
Two people were critically injured in the attack.
Authorities are searching for the bear after the incident.

clusters.title: Bird flu: first ever death from rare H5N5 strain is recorded in US
clusters.neutral_headline: Washington resident dies from rare strain of bird flu, health officials say

items.title: Bird flu: first ever death from rare H5N5 strain is recorded in US
items.standfirst: Washington state resident’s backyard flock of domestic poultry had been exposed to wild birds, health officials saidA person in the US is believed to be the first human to die from a rare strain of bird flu, but state health officials said on Friday the risk to the public is low.The person in Washington state, an older adult with underlying health conditions, was being treated for a bird flu strain called H5N5 after becoming seemingly the first known human infected by the strain, according to a statement from the Washington State Department of Health.This article was amended on 22 November 2025 after the AP corrected its copy to remove a reference to the person’s gender, which has not been released by health officials Continue reading...
items.content: Washington state resident’s backyard flock of domestic poultry had been exposed to wild birds, health officials saidA person in the US is believed to be the first human to die from a rare strain of bird flu, but state health officials said on Friday the risk to the public is low.The person in Washington state, an older adult with underlying health conditions, was being treated for a bird flu strain called H5N5 after becoming seemingly the first known human infected by the strain, according to a statement from the Washington State Department of Health.This article was amended on 22 November 2025 after the AP corrected its copy to remove a reference to the person’s gender, which has not been released by health officials Continue reading...

items.title: Washington resident dies from rare strain of bird flu, health officials say
items.standfirst: The man, an older adult with underlying health conditions, was being treated for a type of bird flu called H5N5.
items.content: The man, an older adult with underlying health conditions, was being treated for a type of bird flu called H5N5.

ai_summary: A person in Washington state died from a rare strain of bird flu.
The strain is called H5N5.
The deceased was an older adult with underlying health conditions.
The risk to the public is considered low by health officials.
The person had been exposed to wild birds.

items.title: US added 119,000 jobs in September in report delayed by federal shutdown
items.standfirst: Unemployment rate hits 4.4%, its highest level since 2021, and government has said no October report will be issuedThe US jobs market added 119,000 jobs in September, according to the latest monthly jobs report, which was delayed by six weeks due to the shutdown of the federal government.Amid heightened uncertainty surrounding the strength of the US economy, the much-anticipated reading was higher than the 51,000 jobs expected by analysts to be added in September. Continue reading...
items.content: Unemployment rate hits 4.4%, its highest level since 2021, and government has said no October report will be issuedThe US jobs market added 119,000 jobs in September, according to the latest monthly jobs report, which was delayed by six weeks due to the shutdown of the federal government.Amid heightened uncertainty surrounding the strength of the US economy, the much-anticipated reading was higher than the 51,000 jobs expected by analysts to be added in September. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The US jobs report for September was delayed due to a government shutdown.
The unemployment rate rose to 4.4%, the highest in four years.
The jobs market added 119,000 jobs in September.
The government will not issue an October report.
The report was delayed by six weeks.

items.title: We could all pay if Europe doesn't step up and guarantee Ukraine's security in face of US betrayal
items.standfirst: The Donald Trump peace plan is nothing of the sort. It takes Russian demands and presents them as peace proposals, in what is effectively for Ukraine a surrender ultimatum.
items.content: The Donald Trump peace plan is nothing of the sort. It takes Russian demands and presents them as peace proposals, in what is effectively for Ukraine a surrender ultimatum.

items.title: Territorial concessions by Ukraine, a capped army and security guarantees: What's in Trump's draft plan

items.content: Ripples of alarm were coursing from Kyiv through Europe, as details emerged of President Donald Trump’s 28-point peace plan for Russia and Ukraine.

ai_summary: Trump's plan could involve territorial concessions by Ukraine.

clusters.title: US government to nix October inflation report after history-making shutdown
clusters.neutral_headline: US Cancels October Inflation Report Due to Shutdown

items.title: US government to nix October inflation report after history-making shutdown
items.standfirst: The Bureau of Labor Statistics has explained it was 'unable to retroactively collect' the data on consumer prices.
items.content: The Bureau of Labor Statistics has explained it was 'unable to retroactively collect' the data on consumer prices.

items.title: US data agency cancels October inflation report as Fed considers whether to cut rates
items.standfirst: Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled release of October’s consumer price index, citing the government shutdownThe US federal government will not publish official data on inflation for October, depriving policymakers at the Federal Reserve of key information as they consider whether to cut interest rates.The Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled the release of the closely watched consumer price index (CPI) for October, citing the government shutdown – the longest in history, before it ended earlier this month – and stating it could not “retroactively collect” the data required for the report. Continue reading...
items.content: Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled release of October’s consumer price index, citing the government shutdownThe US federal government will not publish official data on inflation for October, depriving policymakers at the Federal Reserve of key information as they consider whether to cut interest rates.The Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled the release of the closely watched consumer price index (CPI) for October, citing the government shutdown – the longest in history, before it ended earlier this month – and stating it could not “retroactively collect” the data required for the report. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The United States government will not publish October inflation data.
The Bureau of Labor Statistics cited the government shutdown as the reason.
The shutdown was the longest in United States history.
The agency stated it could not retroactively collect the data.
The Federal Reserve will be deprived of key inflation information.
